resources:
HiClass Formulas Subjects Chapters
//formulas data
//adding formulas for ssc_ch1_real numbers starts. Natural Numbers N = {1,2,3,4,5.....} It is the counting numbers
Whole Numbers W = {0,1,2,3,4,5.....} It is the counting numbers + zero
Integers Z = {...-3,-2,-1,0,1,2,3,...} It is integers
Positive Integers Z+ = {1,2,3,4,5.....} It is positive integer
Negative Integers Z- = {-1,-2,-3,-4,-5.....} It is negative integers
Rational Numbers E.g: 1/2, 4/3, 5/7, 1 etc A number is called rational if it can be expressed in the form of p/q where p and q are integers (q > 0)
Irrational Numbers E.g: √3, √2, etc A number is called rational if it cannot be expressed in the form of p/q where p and q are integers (q > 0)
Real Numbers R All rational and all irrational number makes the collection of real numbers.
All rational and all irrational number makes the collection of real numbers. It is denoted by the letter R
Euclids\'s Division Lemma a=bq + r , 0 ≤ r ≤ b For a and b any two positive integer, we can always find unique integer q and r such that a=bq + r , 0 if r=0, then b is divisor of a.
HCF(Highest Common Factor) HCF(a,b) = HCF(b,r) It is the counting numbers + zero
If HCF(a,b)=1 Then a and b are co-primes Then a and b are co-primes
Fundamental Theorem of Arithmetic Composite number = Product of Primes Composite number = Product of Primes
Important Formula HCF(a,b) X LCM(a,b) = a X b HCF(a,b) X LCM(a,b) = a X b
Important concept for Rational Number Terminating decimal expression can be written in the form p/2n5m Terminating decimal expression can be written in the form p/2n5m
Polynomial Expression S(x)=anxn+an-1xn-1+an-2xn-2+....+ax+a0 HCF(a,b) X LCM(a,b) = a X b
